Executive Summary 



A. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



The Spoetzl Brewery, located in Shiner, Texas is committed to protecting the public, its employees, and the environment from any accidental releases of hazardous materials used at its facilities. We have implemented safety, environmental protection, and risk management programs to prevent the release of hazardous materials.



B. Regulated Substances



The Spoetzl Brewery produces and packages Shiner beer. The ammonia refrigeration system is a utility system supporting the plant by providing space conditioning for beer/intermediates tank storage and various brewing process areas. The system also provides cooling to generate chilled water or glycol through flooded heat exchangers which, in turn, supplies secondary media and/or direct product cooling.



We use and store quantities of Anhydrous Ammonia in excess of 10,000 pounds in our refrigeration system. The industry has used Anhydrous Ammonia for many years as a coolant because it is widely available, relatively inexpensive, and has an exceptional ability to remove large quantities of heat. Although it is designated as an Extremely Hazardous Substance by the Environmental Protection Agency if stored, and handled, properly it is relatively safe to use as a refrigerant.



C. Accidental Release Prevention Program



Spoetzl Brewery has adopted a program to meet the requirements of both the Occupational Safety and Health Act's Process Safety Management standard (PSM) and the EPA's RMP standard. Spoetzl Brewery maintains a release prevention program with the focus of protecting the public, employees, and the environment from hazards associated with an accident or release involving anhydrous ammonia.



The multi-faceted program includes:



* The use of Process Safety Information to document safe process design;

* Operating Procedures to ensure that the system is operated safely;

* Maintenance, inspection and testing of all am

onsite HAZMAT team and emergency response with the Shiner Fire Department, Sheriff's Office, local EMS, and a backup HAZMAT team - Horizon Environmental. If such a release did occur, employees will immediately notify the Spoetzl HAZMAT team, and follow the phone tree to contact local response organizations and the  National Response Center, if necessary.



Our Emergency Action Plan has been revised extensively to ensure that response to any emergency is swift and effective. It addresses measures to protect the lives of employees, contractors, and visitors at the facility. Training is provided to all employees regarding the Emergency Action Plan.



F. Planned changes to improve safety



Spoetzl Brewery continues to strengthen its safety program and continually works to effectively manage the hazards of anhydrous ammonia to protect the community we serve and our employees. Training is in the

forefront of process safety management.



Plant security has being improved with additional measures to provide accountability, limited access to critical areas, and monitoring of contractors and other visitors to the facility, including tourists.



Emphasis is being placed on addressing findings and recommendations from PHA's, Compliance Audits, and Mechanical Integrity inspections to further improve safety.



Safety in all aspects of Spoetzl Brewery operations is part of our culture. Safety is the top priority for our organization. We continue to improve processes, work practices, and enhance the ability of our personnel to assure safe and efficient control as well as management and operation of our plant.
